job_title: Coordinator in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: The college puts time and effort into personal development. Everyone cares about their job.
cons: Compensation is not where it should be.

job_title: RAV in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: decent pay and friendly coworkers
cons: long hours and short staffed

job_title: Fitness Center Monitor in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Connected employee community and helpful leadership
cons: short shifts (2-ish hours) so it's hard to make a lot of money

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: I enjoy working at CC. There are lots of great people on campus and it is really an enjoyable job for the most part. Not too stressful, beautiful grounds.
cons: The biggest downside is that the pay is fairly low. They are trying to address this but it is hard for many people to live off of the pay, at least in the staff positions. We have lost a lot of employees over the past few years due largely to the low pay and high cost of living in this city.

job_title: Coordinator in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Colorado College has an excellent student body who are a pleasure to work with
cons: Pay is uncompetitive and there are few opportunities for advancement. Don't expect to spend your career here.

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: They have very good supporting resource
cons: We have very heavy teaching burden.

job_title: Groundskeeper in Cold Spring, CO
pros: great job for a student
cons: not any cons i can think of

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: - Great community - Lots of opportunities to learn and grow
cons: - Decision making is extremely slow - Tendency for micromanagement - Limited opportunities for advancement

job_title: IT/Broadcasting Manager in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: It is a fun job and it is nice to get to work with all of the different esports teams. The team is nice and easy to work with.
cons: Work times can be sporadic and some weeks are more intense while other weeks have close to only a few hours.

job_title: Accounts Payable Specialist in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Great team to work with
cons: Some disfunction with relationships between Finance and Faculty

job_title: Front Desk in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Can do other work while sat at desk
cons: The hours are not the best

job_title: Animal Care Technician in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: management is awesome, looks out for you and will put in raises when they can
cons: not the highest paying job on campus, CC needs to fund the OBE department more

job_title: Part-time Student Employee in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: easy and met scholarship requirements
cons: Doesn't pay very well, and hours very radically by job.

job_title: Coordinator in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Admirable mission, great people, lovely campus
cons: Compensation package is not as great as they think it is. People need higher wages.

job_title: Student Worker in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:
Diverse array of jobs available
Opportunities to explore many fields
cons: For such a prestigious and expensive institution, the pay is low

job_title: Student Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Great faculty - stimulating academic environment
cons: bad pay considering the resources of the institution

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: PTO is good and the people are friendly
cons: Pay can be poor and they have poor employee retention for majority of positons.

review_title: A Great Place to Get a Start
job_title: Administrative Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:
- Diverse range of staff and faculty co-workers
- Student body is dynamic and unique
- Flexible supervisors and work schedule
- Employer retirement contributions (10%)
cons:
- Pay is not competitive
- Long hours are common

job_title: Investigator in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Friendly staff on campus now
cons: No salary increases ever and more work

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:
Progressive culture and values
Kind people
Campus perks - gym
cons: Despite doing jobs well while working from home, staff were forced back into the office.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: They are really collaborative and understanding
cons: Sometimes it seems competitive but thats fine

job_title: Residential Life Coordinator in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: a lot of perks due to the affluence of the school, a lot of talented professionals, and bright/ambitious student body.
cons: Poor execution of administration and guidance from the senior leadership team, lack of support for staff and students of marginalized identities. Protocol and procedure is not adhered or doesn’t exist at all. high turnover of entry level staff due to burnout.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Free housing and option to work the front desk
cons: Disorganization of all forms, policies, and communication

job_title: IT Staff in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Overall I enjoyed working at Colorado College. The atmosphere in my department was like family, a mix of talented people with some dysfunction.
cons: Lots of work responsibility for not-so-great pay. Some of the departmental promotions that happened didn't seem to make sense. The people promoted didn't seem to work that hard.

job_title: Student Worker in Boulder, CO
pros: great work environment with support from peers and advisors
cons: very low pay that doesn't support lifestyle

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:
* Great benefits

job_title: Plumbing in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Lots of great things offered.
cons: Campus-wide internal politics are pretty bad.

job_title: Learning Manager in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Welcoming, relational, incredible benefits, excellent professional development program.

job_title: Library Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: The minimum wage is higher than in other states.

job_title: Welcome Desk Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:

review_title: Great place to go to school and to work
job_title: Audio Engineer in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Nice people, nice mountains, lots of opportunities.
cons: Colorado Springs is a little weird

job_title: Peer Tutor in Colorado Springs, CO

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Colorado Springs, CO

job_title: Admission Fellow in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Very enjoyable work, being able to speak with prospective students

job_title: IT Student Worker in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: I don't need to travel to work. Good learning experience.

job_title: Coordinator in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Lots of opportunities, great benefits
cons: Covid ruined a lot of perks

job_title: Admission Ambassador in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Colorado College fosters a supportive, collaborative working environment that I am happy to be a part of.
cons: There are no glaring cons!

review_title: Great place to develope interpersonal skills
job_title: Campus Safety Officer in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:
- Flexible
- Independent
- Benefits i.e. vacation
cons:
- Pay
- PT hours can be minimal

job_title: Research Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: There was good creative freedom
cons: There was no upward mobility

job_title: Undergraduate Admissions Ambassador in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Get to lead tours, meet people who are interested in CC
cons: Mostly virtual in corona season right now.

review_title: CC has a great mission but is slow to change.  Jill Tiefenthaler is a great leader.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Colorado College has great students, professors, and current administrative leadership.  CC offers staff great amenities and the workload is very reasonable.
cons: CC is very slow to change.  Part of this has to do with shared governance with the faculty but CC also has a weird tendency to promote people within the administration who do not maintain a high level of professionalism.  The administrative staff is bloated and some people don't seem used to working hard.  There is very little opportunity for students to offer feedback on the administration's work and there is little accountability in some positions.

review_title: An intense and rewarding work experience
job_title: Assistant to the Directors At the CC Summer Music Festival in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: The best part of the job is working closely with some of the most talented and renowned musicians in the United States, both established and up-and-coming.  I also gained a great deal of experience in seeing the inner workings of music administration at an extremely high level.
cons: This job, because it is an integral part of the 3-week festival, is incredibly intense. Often work begins early in the morning and goes late at night. Stage-managing high-level concerts is also very stressful.

review_title: Highly Racially and Sexually Charged Environment
job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: There were some really good people with good intentions there.  The salary is amazing.
cons: Racism and sexism is rampant.  Was told that I needed to be aware that promotion committee needed to keep in mind my gender as a negative towards promotion.  No action was taken when I brought this up to the administration.  Race had a role in similar decisions with regard to my colleagues.  This did not impact white males.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Great place to start out part-time work. Staff are really helpful and many want you to grow. If you want, there are many opportunities for you to undergo training to help prepare you for the real world.
cons: I really can't complain. Training hours can be long and are unpaid but other than that a great community to work with!

job_title: Student Worker in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Flexible schedule is a huge pro. I can always talk to my boss about working more or less, depending on my school workload.
cons: Not much emphasis on leadership development. One must seek out resources if one needs them for planning events or special projects.

job_title: Gallery Monitor in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Creative environment, flexible hours, and great co-workers, fun events. Great opportunity for someone interested in gaining professional gallery experience.
cons: Minimal challenge  or opportunity for upward mobility. Often long shifts. The hourly wage is not a lot, but then again the work is not very challenging...But that may be why some are attracted to this position.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Great retirement program, positive change is in the air, seeing directly how you impact students lives is powerful.
cons: The "Human Resources" department is anything but, Upper management needs to be more cognizant of what what their direct reports are doing and how they're treating their respective employees. Pay is below-average.

job_title: Grounds Crew in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Great work as a student, good pay (above Colorado minimum wage) and completely understanding of the need to occasionally change shifts etc.
cons: I couldn't continue job in the summer after graduation which was frustrating since I spent all of senior year working on my thesis, and not so much searching for a post-graduation job.

job_title: Tutor in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Friendly. intelligent, supportive, and intelligent staff. Working here is great, and I am always learning, even when I am teaching. The location is great too.
cons: The dogmatic liberalism can lead to a supression of free speech and expression. While the school is progressive and reflective, there can sometimes be some serious group-think in the culture.

review_title: This is far better then I could have anticipated!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: I am quite excited by the prospect of working here for many more years! This company will let you stay after infractions that would have you fired anywhere else!
cons: Be careful not to get caught drinking on the job. Otherwise, you are free to do whatever you like!

review_title: Best on-campus job for people interested in videography and photography
job_title: Video Intern in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Lots of learning opportunities, incredible leadership open to pitching, directing, filming and editing your videos. Flexible work schedule
cons: Not all gear is incredibly top of the line but you do get some hands on work with the C200 which is good to know about

job_title: Colorado College Admission Fellowship in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:
1. You get to influence the incoming class
2. Great coworkers 
3. Opportunities to travel to parts of the country to interview prospective students 
4. Flexible hours
5. Cutler always has snacks
cons: No downsides to work for Admission

review_title: Great experience as an FYE mentor!
job_title: FYE Mentor in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Professors and FYE program leader really support and respect your input. Money allocated for event planning was easily accessible and enabled FYE mentors to organize engaging events.
cons: It was sometimes hard to get new students to attend events.

job_title: Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Colorado College is a wonderful institution, and to work on campus was amazing. There were opportunities for staff to learn all the time, and I felt very involved.
cons: I honestly can't think of any, other than a few personality conflicts which are inevitable everywhere you go.

job_title: Program Coordinator in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Beautiful campus located in downtown Colorado Springs. Great place to work with teachers, students and administrators.
cons: Pay is on the lower side for non-exempt staff and clerical positions but benefits are great.

job_title: Paraprofessional in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Colorado College is a beautiful campus with a very friendly community
cons: The college still has a lot of work to do in terms of catching up with and to social justice. However, I am impressed by the College's effort and push for social justice

job_title: Paraprofessional in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: compensation, school values, work-life balance is manageable
cons: personal growth could use some work. more structure of the day-to-day for this position

job_title: GIS Lab Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: The GIS Lab offers a wide range of opportunities to help learn the program from many angles, with flexible hours as a full-time student.
cons: The work is computational, so if the internet is slow it can be frustrating.

job_title: Student Manager in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Nice staff, good experience. Working during the school year is much better.
cons: The organization of the college is questionable. In particular, it depends on which department.

review_title: It is a great place to work, with even better people.
job_title: Career Center: Special Projects Coordinator in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:
Great work environment.
Amazing people
Work Life balance
cons: There are no cons at this point

job_title: Student Worker in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Student workers are treated pretty nicely. I've never had any complaints.
cons: With the school hiring more and more student workers, it's getting harder to get hours.

review_title: Great place to work as a student
job_title: Grager in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Very flexible work environment to work around student learning hours. Wonderful professors to work with.
cons: Not much opportunity for growth -- most positions are only available to current students

job_title: Admission Fellow in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Strong emphasis on professional development for student workers.
cons: Small town feel can be too small. The campus is energizing environment, but the pay is not high unless you're in managerial positions.

review_title: Great place to work and learn.
job_title: Research Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Most research assistant positions have flexible schedules around class time. The professors are great. Adequate, but not outstanding student pay scale.
cons: None worth making hay over.

job_title: in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Friendly, kind people with lots of opportunities to contribute ideas, even as an intern
cons: Things move very slowly and it takes a while for anything to get approved.

job_title: Call Center Manager in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Flexible Hours, Competitive Pay, Understanding Staff
cons: Hours can be long, for a college job. Sometimes the alumni and parents we call aren't always the most understanding.

job_title: Planner in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Nice people, intellectual environment, beautiful Colorado sunshine.
cons: Colorado Springs as a city is perhaps not the best place to live for a young professional.

job_title: Communications Intern in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Flexible hours, friendly with student workers, committed to what the college's fundamental beliefs
cons: Micromanagement by some supervisors, little room for advancement, or travel for work.

job_title: Student Worker in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Friendly working environment, learn a lot on the job, extremely nice faculty, flexible work schedule
cons: Didn't feel like I was learning new things

job_title: Lifeguard in San Diego, CA
pros: Easy, Relaxed, helpful, and caring
cons: May be to easy and relaxed

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Slidell, LA

job_title: Student Caller in Colorado Springs, CO

review_title: Fun to work, good hours, good pay

job_title: Intramural Referee in Colorado Springs, CO

job_title: Intramural Referee in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Friendly staff and very accommodating to student's schedules
